place.name: COLTON
place.gazetteerText: COLTON, a parish in Forehoe district, Norfolk; on the river Blackwater, 3 miles NNE of Kimberley r. station, and 5¼ N of Wymondham. Post town, Marlingford, under Norwich. Acres, 911. Real property, £1, 862. Pop., 228. Houses, 55. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £348. Patron, the Lord Chancellor. The church is good. A school has £9 from endowment; and other charities £27. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
